sentence.text: ` Well , ai n't you gonna pop in an " chew tonguewag with moi ? " the fortune-teller screeched .
` You filthy pig ! " she screeched .
` Come here ! " the man screeches .
That 's what you are , " the old man screeched now .
" What 's new ? " he screeched .
` Now look what you 've made me do ! " she screeched .
` That 's their bad luck , " screeched Mum .
` One man ! " screeched Lin Foh , and slapped his sides in exasperation .
` Yiu keelled heem ! " screeched Lorre , his shaking hands reaching for a revolver .
Hordes of admirers screech that they would be only too willing to take Kylie home and look after her for a while .
He can turn his head away from the screams , the pleas , the heart-rending shouts that split the night air -- suffering human beings screeching their injustice at the outside world .

Nicky was half aware of the Mercedes that approached them , and a moment later he screeched his warning to Lou , watching frozen , and horrified , as the great car drove up onto the pavement and bore down upon them .
The naughty monkeys screeched their high-pitched calls as the Pack Council met to discuss the man cub 's future .
` Who ? " screeched Aunt Lou down the telephone now .
At intervals while we were negotiating with him , he screeched his battle songs and war cries .

Mao , on the other hand , actually presided over gatherings of a million crying and cheering devotees , before bodily and mental decline made personal enjoyment of ecstatic Red Guards screeching their devotion impossible .
The woman began to screech her rage as I went through the doors and out into the High Street .
Topknot screeched something back at Gurder .
Instead she rushed angrily about the house , screeching threats and peering uselessly into dark corners in the pretence of looking for a switch .
She suddenly started screeching at Bruno , so abruptly that Maxim felt a jab in his spine and knew he 'd come very close to being shot .
I suddenly screeched at her , ` I do n't want to know ! " and threw down the phone and pushed myself out of the door .
` No , Clive , " she screeched at him , ` it 's not for last time .
` Tog ort ! " he would screech in his high-pitched voice .
Driving round Piccadilly Circus in a taxi he would screech out of the window , ` I 'm the Queen of England but I ca n't remember which . "
Women 's voices , men 's voices , children 's voices screeched out curses and threats .
